page.title: 17THE FARMERS ATTITUDES
page.content: The farmer was concerned about the bad image farmers have as a result of being known to be subsidised by the government. Another problem is political policy;one minute the government encourages the farmers to produce more and the next to cut back-an impossible reversal.It also worried him that there was no way of using the surplus grain he produces to help the famine in places like Ethopia which would never be self sufficent because of the climate. Imports were another problem as this farm used to produce hay and sell it to local racing stables but now they buy imported hay which is cheaper and more uniform in quality. Insurance of crops is too expensive so if a crop is damaged by hailstones for example,the farmer suffers a loss.His traditional problem,weather is still the main one!
